body.p: The revised Chapter 1 reintroduces the term ‘stewardship’ and explains that the assessment of management’s stewardship involves assessing how efficiently and effectively the entity’s management and governing board have discharged their responsibilities to use the entity’s economic resources (see paragraphs 1.4 and 1.22–1.23). That assessment enables users of financial statements to hold management to account for its actions. The Board’s use of the term ‘stewardship’ is consistent with the general understanding of that term: the careful and responsible management of something entrusted to one’s care. These improvements to Chapter 1 provide increased clarity and the Board concluded that this outweighs the translation difficulties identified in 2010.
